work.name: College of Engineering and Computer Science at Syracuse University
work.summary: Conducting research under Professor Reza Zafarani at Syracuse University to investigate the memory mechanisms of large language models (LLMs) and analyze their similarities to human memory processes. Responsibilities include designing queries, analyzing model outputs, and contributing to theoretical insights into artificial intelligence cognition.

work.name: Martin J. Whitman School of Management at Syracuse University
work.summary: Conducting research under Professor Si Cheng at Syracuse University, focusing on machine learning applications in finance. Responsibilities include data analysis, algorithm development, and exploring innovative solutions to financial modeling challenges.

courses: Elements of Computer Science, Calculus 3 Plus, Linear Algebra, Introduction to Abstract Mathematics

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
